name: Electrode

abilities.name: Buzzap
abilities.text: At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may Knock Out Electrode and attach it to 1 of your other Pokemon. If you do, choose a type of Energy. Electrode is now an Energy card (instead of a Pokemon) that provides 2 energy of that type. You can't use this power if Electrode is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Electric Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Electrode does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: It stores electrical energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

strengths: Buzzap provides 2 energy of ANY type instantly
Can power up any Pokemon in any deck
weaknesses: Buzzap gives opponent a free Prize card
Knocking Out your own Pokemon is costly
synergies: Any Stage 2 with high energy cost
counters: Prize denial is built into Buzzap

description: Electrode is a Stage 1 Lightning-type Pokemon with the unique Buzzap Pokemon Power. Buzzap allows Electrode to sacrifice itself to become 2 energy of any type, providing massive energy acceleration at the cost of a Prize card.
competitiveHistory: Electrode saw play as an energy accelerator in various combo decks. Buzzap's ability to provide 2 energy of any type made it valuable for powering up heavy attackers quickly, despite the Prize card cost.

rulings.ruling: When you use Buzzap, Electrode is Knocked Out and your opponent takes a Prize card.
Electrode as an Energy card provides 2 energy of the type you chose when using Buzzap.
If the Pokemon Electrode is attached to is Knocked Out, Electrode goes to the discard pile as an Energy card.
